data.title: Great wedding venue
data.text: We attended a wedding at Lillie belles. I know they also have a tea room type restaurant but I have not eaten there.  The wedding was a lovely outdoor wedding, under tents on the patio.  After the wedding a bar was set in the garden while the staff quickly turned the " chapel" into a reception hall under the stars and twinkling lights.  It was a lovely place for a small wedding and the bride, groom and wedding party all stayed at the B&B

data.title: Great location for a B&B
data.text: I am confused on this establishment being in the restaurant category.  We stayed 2 nights here (The Inn at the Square).  This beautiful, old home has several functions.  As a B&B and as an event venue.  We stayed in the King Suite which was an addition to the main house.  We understand the main house contained three additional rooms upstairs that are also available for reservations.  Our room was nice.  It was a large room with a sitting area.  Tucked in one corner was a mini fridge and a table with a coffee pot.  Coffee, sweetners & creamer were supplied.  There were several bottles of water in the fridge.  Also supplied were wine glasses and a corkscrew.  The owner supplied us with vouchers for breakfast, good at several establishments downtown within walking distance.  The breakfasts were awesome. Loved being able to order what we wanted. The location of the Inn couldn't have been much better.  We love walking downtown enjoying the scenery and shopping. My only complaint was lack of an area in the room to hang clothing.  Hope to visit again in the near future.

data.title: Wedding reception turned nightmare
data.text: Absolute wonderful food. Absolute terrible service. The owners are a couple...a couplb of crazies. Will never return. They called cops on a guest for smoking too close to the back yard patio. Nightmare.

data.title: Tea Room for Ladies' Lunch
data.text: Tea Room for Ladies' Lunch. Nice place for sandwiches, sweet tea & girl talk. Not at all a place for hot wings & SEC football.

data.title: Bridesmaid luncheon
data.text: Quaint, beautiful Victorian home, walking distance to historic downtown Franklin. Lunch unfortunately was mediocre. Only enjoyed the soup and the guest!

data.title: Wedding Venue
data.text: Attended a wedding there this weekend. The whole event was beautiful and very comfortable. The outdoor area was all set up for wedding then quickly changed over to reception area. The food was very good. This is a beautiful place for a small wedding. Parking could be issue so make time for finding a spot.

data.title: A very special place
data.text:
Franklin is a quaint historic town with antique shops, a lively main street and historic homes. A day trip or quick visit always calls for a special dining experience. Lillie Belle's lovely old Victorian house invites you inside for a cup of tea or lunch! They are open Tuesday through Saturday from 11:00 until 2:00 and unless you have six or more in your party you do not need reservations.  I recently visited with friends from out of town. We had a special day! Lillie Belle's was the perfect way to enjoy our time together.
This used to be a tea room, closed and became a venue for weddings and receptions only.  Now it is open as a restaurant. It has all the charm of a tea room-lovely tablecloths and napkins, delicate china and your own personal pot of tea if you like, but business men and tourists will be seen eating there as well. Prices are reasonable. The food is delicious and the servers, friendly and attentive. Just wait until you see the dessert tray! You will definitely want to save room for that. I had the Georgia Pecan cake and it was, as the young folks say, "awesome"! Everyone else at our table said the same about theirs.
Lillie Belle's is easy to find. The blue house is hard to miss, just off the town square. Hwy.96 becomes 3rd Ave. and it is on the left just before round-about.
